climbs.name: Splitter Splatter Lets Stem At Er

content.description: Easy Dihedral start. Continue up to place first protection with DMM Dragon size 6-7-8. Continue up to horizontal seam which offers possible protection from Dragon 1 or Metolius 2-3 but a runner would be needed. Closer to corner the crack is flared. Continue up with Dragon 5-6-7-8 passing a ledge to the right. A slight tilt begins just where Fist Jamb, Foot Jamb and Arm Bars begin to work for average sized folks. Work through small bulge to a rounded top-out with good crystals for grip. Short Walk Off to the north.
content.protection: No Anchors or Bolts. Possible to fix Top Rope from above on boulders with 20' slings or static rope. Bring Large Cams (Dragon 5-6-7-8, or Camalots 3-6) and a few smaller cams JIC.

content.description: Nestled on a natural edge looking over the Mt Scott Picnic Area, Elmer Thomas, and Lake Lawtonka, Bobcat's Atrium offers a great rest spot from the heat and sun or from a north wind - shade should be available all day year round with 3 mature conifers inside. This natural alcove is accessible from the south (0.3 miles) and north (0.2 miles) but even from a short distance this cozy room with a view may go unnoticed. Similarly two nice chimney climbs are similarly hidden in plain sight nearby.Multiple routes are available to in Bobcat's Atrium including Splitter Splatter Let's Stem At Er, an unnamed project Arete on the south side, the boulder face that comprises the NE wall, and flakey climbs on the southern exterior wall. Nearby chimneys may be tagged since they are very close to this natural room. Hike in, set up a nice rest for lunch or a nap out of noon sun, and keep an eye out for local residents - Bobcats!
